chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Alan Altpeter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven Alan Altpeter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven Alan Altpeter was found guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
DE must take psych assessment and followthrough with any recommendations.

DE must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol as well as any controlled substances unless they have been prescribed by a physician and then may only be taken exactly as prescribed in the manner and form prescribed.
DE to participate  in any treatment or counseling programs as deemed necessary by agent.
Restitution is from dismissed but read in case 16CM36

records.addlTxt:
1:22 pm - DA calls cases 16CF22 and 16CM36 and states appearances.  Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI.  DA certifies victims rights compliance. Facts of case stated by DA.  Argument by Atty Richards.  Comments by DE.  DE to submit DNA sample at PRSO.  Summation by Court.

Court imposes on Ct 3 of 16CF22
24 years prison, 10 years initial confinement, 14 years extended supervision  Credit for 1 day served.  Consecutive to any other sentence in being.
Court costs of $268
DNAAS of $250
Restitution of $300 + 30 = $330 on DRI case 16CM36
DE must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol as well as any controlled substances unless they have been prescribed by a physician and then may only be taken exactly as prescribed in the manner and form prescribed.
DE must take psych assessment and followthrough along with any treatment and counseling programs as necessary

DE not eligible for challenge incarceration program or substance abuse program.

Appeal rights given.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven Alan Altpeter
Current: Price County Jail 164 Cherry Street P.O. Box B, Phillips, WI 54555   (Effective: 09-27-2016)
Prior: Price County Jail 164 Cherry Street, Phillips, WI 54555
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

11:00 am - DA calls cases 16CM36 and 16CF22 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information has been filed, acknowleged and reading is waived.  Atty Richards presents court with waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court questions DE regarding waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver.   DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Count 3 in 16CF22.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire form.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims right compliance.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 3 of 16CF22, and on motion of state dismisses Cts 1 and 2 of 16CF22, and dismisses but reads in Ct 1 in 16CM36 for purposes of restitution.  Court orders Pre Sentence investigation.  Bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

10:00 am -   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.Defendant Steven Alan Altpeter appeared with attorney James R. Lex, Jr. for purposes of today's hearing.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence
Search warrant; application and affidavit; return of officer
Search warrant; application and affidavit; return of officer

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may have no contact with C.M.M., DOB 03-14-03 or any females under age 18.

10:31 am - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges.  DE next court date is 3-29-16 at 10 am.  Court gives DE a notice of right to attorney and victim witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint. Court sets bond.
